text: My name is Kadhir Kanniyappan.
I'm a Vice President
of Observability in Capital One.

As part of our broader
technology transformation journey

Capital One exited our last
legacy on-prem data centers

to become the first U.S.
financial institution
to go all in on the public cloud
with AWS as our strategic cloud partner.

We leverage Amazon CloudWatch
as our go-to for all logs.
But incomplete logging

and monitoring setups can
lead to visibility gaps.
That's where AWS Config

and AWS CloudTrail come in,
enhancing our security

and observability to keep
us ahead in the cloud game.

While development is
fast-paced, governance
and security services
and tooling like AWS Organizations, SCP,

RCPs and IAM helps us
to stay well managed.
Empowering our teams to build on AWS

has enabled innovative
customer experiences.

Going all in cloud has enabled
both instant provisioning
of infrastructure and rapid innovation.

New services are being introduced
all the time, allowing us

to leverage the latest
infrastructure capabilities
immediately. We are now able
to manage data at a much larger scale
and unlock the power of AI and ML.
